name: Stellar Main Sequence Lifetime
explanation: Main sequence lifetime is how long a star fuses hydrogen. More massive stars burn fuel faster despite having more fuel. Lifetime ∝ M/L, and L ∝ M³.⁵, so lifetime ∝ M⁻².⁵. Massive stars live millions of years, low-mass stars live trillions. Determines stellar evolution and galaxy composition.

examples.problem: Sun's main sequence lifetime is 10 billion years. What is lifetime for 10 solar mass star?
Why do massive stars die young?
examples.solution: Higher luminosity means faster fuel consumption, despite more fuel
